item.title: Rheumatoid arthritis kept her captive. This nerve stimulator set her free
item.description: A new surgically implanted device the size of a lima bean can help control rheumatoid arthritis that isn't responding to drugs.

item.title: This small Virginia island could be underwater before the next century
item.description: Tangier Island in Virginia — one of the last inhabited islands in the Chesapeake Bay — is under threat from rising sea levels and climate change.

item.title: What to know as U.N. General Assembly opens, marking 80 years, tackling deep crises
item.description: This year the United Nations is marking its 80th anniversary, but diplomats don't have much to celebrate.

item.title: France transfixed by 'no body' murder trial
item.description: Cédric Jubillar has always denied killing his wife Delphine, who vanished in December 2020.

item.title: Thousands protest in Brazil against bill that could grant Bolsonaro amnesty
item.description: Tens of thousands take to the streets of major cities to oppose a bill which could spare the ex-leader jail.

item.title: 5 home equity borrowing traps to watch for this fall, according to experts
item.description: Don't borrow from your home equity this season without first understanding these five timely traps, experts say.

item.title: Trump hails Charlie Kirk as martyr to thousands at memorial service
item.description: The US president broke with the forgiveness message of Kirk's widow, Erika, to say he hated his opponents.

item.title: Sarah Ferguson dropped from charity over Epstein email
item.description: The children's hospice charity says it would be inappropriate for her to continue as a patron of the charity.

item.title: Egypt's president pardons British-Egyptian activist Alaa Abdel Fattah
item.description: The British-Egyptian activist is one of six people whose sentences President Abdul Fattah al-Sisi commuted, according to state media.
